file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-43-03-04 - SERVICE DOOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SERVICE DOOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the folding flap of the service door. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SERVICE DOOR FOLDING FLAP - RE- ALL 52-43-03-000-801-A MOVAL SERVICE DOOR FOLDING FLAP - IN- ALL 52-43-03-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-43-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-43-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SERVICE DOOR FOLDING FLAP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the folding flap of the service door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM 52-43-00 - AMM MPP 06-45-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 52-43-04-000-801-A/400 SERVICE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To remove the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Service door 1 Helps the other technician Service door EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the service door (AMM 52-43-00). (2) Remove lining panel 821CW ( AMM MPP 06-45-00/100). (3) Remove the rubber-trim seal from the contour of the folding flap (AMM TASK 52-43-04-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the cotter pin (4), nut (3), washer (2), and bolt (12) to disconnect the rod (11) end from the support at the folding flap (1). (2) Remove the nuts (10), washers (9), and screws (5) (13 positions) that attach the folding flap (1) to the hinge (8). (3) Remove the plate (6) and the rubber trim (7). (4) Remove the folding flap (1). (5) If necessary, remove the folding flap edge (13) as follows: (a) Support the folding flap (1) on a bench. (b) Remove the nuts (16), washers (15), and screws (14) (20 positions) that attach the folding flap edge (13) to the folding flap (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Folding Flap - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 821 DET. A 14. SCREW (20) 13. FOLDING FLAP EDGE 1. FOLDING 3. NUT 2. WASHER FLAP 15. WASHER (20) 4. COTTER PIN 5. SCREW (13) 16. NUT (20) RUBBER-TRIM 6. PLATE SEAL (REF.) 7. RUBBER TRIM 8. HINGE 12. BOLT 10. NUT 9. WASHER 11. ROD DET. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-43-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SERVICE DOOR FOLDING FLAP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the folding flap of the service door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 52-43-00 - AMM 52-43-00 - AMM MPP 06-45-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES SERVICE-DOOR RUBBER-TRIM SEAL - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 52-43-04-400-801-A/400 TION SERVICE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECH- AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500 ANISM - FUNCTIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To install the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Service Door Parts 52-43-00 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-43-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Service door 1 Helps the other technician Service door I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the folding flap (1) on the hinge (8). (2) Put the rubber trim (7) and the plate (6) on the folding flap (1) at the hinge (8). (3) Install the screws (5), washers (9), and nuts (10) (13 positions) to attach the folding flap (1) to the hinge (8). NOTE: For torque, refer to (AMM MPP 20-10-01/200). (4) Connect the rod (11) end to the support at the folding flap (1) and attach it with the bolt (12), washer (2), nut (3) and new cotter pin (4). (5) Install the rubber-trim seal on the contour of the folding flap (AMM TASK 52-43-04-400-801-A/400). (6) If applicable, install the folding flap edge (13) as follows: (a) Put the folding flap edge in position. (b) Install a minimum of three screws (14) and measure the gaps. Refer to AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500. (c) Install the remaining screws (14). (7) Do a check of the service door-to-fuselage skin step, as given in AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500, at points 11, 12 and 13. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an operational check of the service door. (2) If necessary, adjust the actuation and locking mechanism of the service door ( AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500). (3) Install lining panel 821CW ( AMM MPP 06-45-00/100). (4) Close the service door (AMM 52-43-00).
